question.text: Your motor insurance policy has an excess of £100. What does this mean?

explanation.text: This is a method used by insurance companies to keep annual premiums down. Generally, the higher the excess you choose to pay, the lower the annual premium you will be charged.

answer.text: The insurance company will pay the first £100 of any claim
You will be paid £100 if you do not have a crash
Your vehicle is insured for a value of £100 if it is stolen
You will have to pay the first £100 of any claim
